body.p: A container for template.XULElem("toolbar")s. It is a type of box but defaults to vertical orientation. If a template.XULElem("toolbar") is placed inside a toolbox, a template.XULElem("grippy") is displayed on its left or upper edge. The user may click the template.XULElem("grippy") to collapse the template.XULElem("toolbar"). If multiple toolbars are placed in the same toolbox, they will all collapse into the same row. The Firefox browser does not have grippies so toolbars cannot be collapsed and expanded.

div.p: Gecko 2.0 geckoRelease("2.0") adds support for external toolbars. These are toolbars that are not children of a toolbox. You can associate an external XULElem("toolbar") with a toolbox for the purpose of managing your toolbars by setting the XULProp("toolboxid") property on the toolbar. The external toolbars associated with a toolbox are listed in the array of elements provided by the toolbox's XULProp("externalToolbars")Â property.

body.p: More information is available in the XUL tutorial.
If you'd like to detect when toolbars in a toolbox are changed, see Toolbar customization events.
